intro: Phoradendron gaumeri, commonly known as the Mexican mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on a variety of host trees, primarily in the southwestern United States and Mexico. Phoradendron gaumeri plays a significant role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitats.
